website_summaries.verdict: Customers with average-sized feet and socks may want to try this sock aid from RMS Medical. It's not as helpful for those who wear compression stockings or have larger feet.
pros: Soft and flexible, designed for those with weak hand strength
Soft, non-slip foam handle for a comfortable grip
Takes some effort, but you can get socks on yourself
cons: Does not work well with compression stockings, or with wide feet
If you are having trouble getting regular socks on, try sliding the sock all the way up the shell rather than just the end

customer_reviews.title: Info not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: No good for folks with wide feet. I have a sock aid that cracked so I bought this to replace it. The broken one was 5 inches wide. Fit my wide feet. This one states 5 inches wide but doesn't stipulate it is 5 inches wide at the base and only maybe 4 inches at the toe. Could get my foot in the base area but not the toe area so this proved useless for me. I will order another on this site that I had before that is 5 inches wide on both ends!
customer_reviews.author: HappyGrillMore

customer_reviews.title: Pictures do NOT tell the real story
customer_reviews.text: Ad pictures are not adequate; really easy to use, but you should put the sock complete on the puller. See my pic. With size 14 foot and size 13 cotton socks, it works like a charm. Can pull them all the way up my ankle and leg. At first, I did not put the sock on far enough, but that is the trick. You also might want to put a clean sock on your good foot, if you have one, to stretch it, then put that sock on the Puller. I am 79 and can not put a sock on my left foot; this tool is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!  Item is a fraud.  Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Very seldom write reviews and negative ones. Bought this to aid me in putting on my socks. No way am I going to get my socks over the end of the unit. It is a big, wide unit in which none of my socks will fit over. The company shows instructional photos of putting on a sock with the unit. Where they got a sock like that I'll never know. As said, none of my socks are that wide. Wasted my money on this piece of garbage. If I saw this in a store, would never have bought it but on the computer can't compare. Will have to buy a new one. Live and learn. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nardone

customer_reviews.title: This does not make it easier to put on TED hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me put TED hose on my mom after her knee replacement surgery. We used it 4 times before the black foam piece on the back tore. We have found that putting the TED hose on with our bare hands or latex gloves works much easier than trying to thread them onto the top of the Sock Aid. I can not image an older person trying to get the stocking onto the Sock Aid. It took me manipulating the top to a smaller opening before the stocking would even come close to fitting on the Aid. I thought it would make the job easier and definitly last more than 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: F. Quintieri

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect. The price is right
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect.The price is right..Very easy to use and my partner and I love it really helpful my partner just having a little trouble putting his sock on we decided to purchase one of this unique product that we didn't know are exist.compared to other expensive and fancy product this one is very helpful and easy to use I would recommend this product can be used for men and women .Very happy we have this product I'm not worry about my partner to put his sock on alone.
customer_reviews.author: Winwin

customer_reviews.title: I have gone through 3
customer_reviews.text: I have needed to use one of these since I was a kid. I had my first one for 25 years when it finally snapped when a recliner accidentally was set on top of it. That one was made of quality material. I got this one three times. When you flex it to put the sock on it cracks. If the socks are too tight it cracks right down the middle every time. That crack eventually snaps the aid right in half. Cheap materials to get you to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately.........
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this did not work for us. I bought it to help my husband who has PAD put on his 20-30 compression socks. But.....when we placed the sock on the plastic form, it squeezed the form almost shut and was impossible to move the sock. It also created a lot of pain in my husband's foot. The front of the plastic piece compressed almost to a "V" shape and his toes were caught inside the smaller end of the "v".......a great idea but did not work for us....maybe this is for people who use a lighter compression in their socks....like a 5-10......did not work for us. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PCB

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Sock Aid for my 93 year old mother to help her put on compression socks. I couldn't get the socks on the device! We didn't even let her try it! The plastic was too hard to bend.
customer_reviews.author: Howie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This aid did not work for my husband who has Parkinson's disease. It is very stiff and so very hard for him to get his sock on; I even found it somewhat difficult to "load" and I have good strength. In fact, it took more energy to use this aid than it did to struggle to get on his socks without it. I'd say that it'd probably be fine for someone who has good upper body strength, but if your problem is some disease that leaves you weakened, look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: HappilyRetired

customer_reviews.title: I was embarrassed to try it
customer_reviews.text: I tore the muscle in my hip and bruised the bone. Bending my leg to put on socks was excruciating. I didn't want my wife to have to do it for me, so, reluctantly, I bought this. I wish I'd bought it a month earlier. You put the sock on the device, slip your foot in and pull on the ropes. The sock is comfortably seated on your foot with (in my case at least) no pain. Works on gym socks, anklets and regular men's stockings. Wonderful, inexpensive device.
customer_reviews.author: thomas j. stewart

customer_reviews.title: Simple and marvelous
customer_reviews.text: The sock aid works better if your socks are fairly soft and flexible. I have both kinds -- soft and stiff -- and the stiff socks definitely take a bit more energy to fit around the sock aid. But they will fit! I have small feet, and it does take some tugging, but it works. This is a marvelous invention. My husband and I are in our 70's and not as flexible as we were just a few years ago. We'd both taken to wearing shoes that didn't need socks, but then winter came, and we needed socks but dreaded putting them on. Not anymore -- we actually look forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Gearhart

customer_reviews.title: Wasted purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to try to help put on compression socks, as I have a bad back. Trying to get the sock onto this product was just as hard, if not worse, than just putting the socks on myself directly. Wasted purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A D

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to pull compression socks onto this device so it is useless
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible for me to pull my over-the-calf-length compression socks onto this device. The device is too large to fit inside the socks, even though I wear extra-large compression socks. I struggled and struggled and pulled and pulled, and just could not get my socks onto the device. I tried just pulling the socks halfway onto the device, but then the socks would not get all the way onto my feet. I had to return this device because it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Maui fan

customer_reviews.title: Great  product that works.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had spinal surgery and can't bend over at this time. This product is top notch and he is very pleased with it's function. It does what it says it will do 100% - helps those with disabilities put their socks on by themselves easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn A. Barth

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: This gadget simply was not wide enough to accommodate my foot. It also was unable to pull my compression hose up at all.I suppose if you have a skinny foot and are putting on casual knit sock, it might do the trick for you. But it did not work at all for me. I am hard headed I guess. Other raters told me this would be the outcome. Caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: docjack

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile to put it together because I only had me to do it. It is sturdy and high enough to have the cubie holes that I use. One note though...when fastening metal to metal, then you have the squeaks, etc. Maybe the supplier can add some rubber type of washers to use with the screws. I used an old rubber mouse pad and made my own, So far, quiet as a church mouse. No problem so far. It is a good investment as metal does not dry out, etc. Better than wood. I have recommended mine to some of my friends too. Thanks for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: Poppatoy

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully! So helpful after hip surgery!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Simply slip the sock over the open end of the plastic device, grab both rope handles, insert your foot in the plastic device, and pull on the ropes to install the sock. I wear ankle high socks, so need just a little bit of help to get them pulled on tightly. If you wear calf high socks, you can pull them tight yourselves. Great product, well worth the money. I coupled this tool with a 31" shoe horn and Sperry pull on boat sneakers to allow myself to put my shoes and socks on by myself.
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my big feet
customer_reviews.text: My swollen size 13+ feet don't fit easily the channel. It is also a little awkward getting the sock on the helper in the right position, and using the rope and handles to get the sock on is a lesson in frustration that depends solely on how you move the helper and ropes. I felt considerably more handicapped than before I used it. I'm sure it's useful for someone. It only made me more determined to find a way to do it without aid. I'm much happier now, and spend less time, just getting my socks on.
customer_reviews.author: John Maliga

customer_reviews.title: Deluxe Sock Aid
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work as the directions say. I would not recommend it to anyone. I felt it was a waste of money. It stated to pull the sock on the plastic piece then pull the handles to slide it over the heal and the sock up. It would never pull over the heal at all.
customer_reviews.author: William Muscarella

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with support hose. I wear knee ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with support hose. I wear knee high support hose. It was almost impossible to pull the sock onto the sockaid. But with much effort I was able to do so. If you have the strength to do this you probably are healthy enough to not need it. When you put your foot in the sock and then pull, it just pulls the device out of the sock but doens't pull the sock up. I gave it 2 stars as II suspect this would probably work with regular ankle high dress or athletic socks but I didn't bother to try that as that's not what I wear. Returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Shep

customer_reviews.title: Great for pregnant women as well!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m in my third trimester and bending over to put on socks has been a pain. I purchased this sock aid to help me throughout the rest of my pregnancy since it’s winter time, so sandals and flip flops won’t get me through this time around. It’s easy to use and surprisingly even works with small no show socks. It looks big at first but it holds the socks well and doesn’t leave them all stretched out like I thought it would. I ended up purchasing an additional one for my mother who has hip pain when she bends over to put on her right sock, and she likes the ease of using it at well.
customer_reviews.author: Tired mommy

customer_reviews.title: A NECESSARY AID FOR SENIORS
customer_reviews.text: I AM 89 AND I HAVE BEEN USING A SOCK AID FOR 13 YEARS. IT CRACKED AND I ORDERED THIS AS A REPLACEMENT. IT IS A LITTLE NARROWER THAN THE PREVIOUS ONE BUT IT IS LARGE ENOUGH. I WEAR A 10.5 WIDE SHOE. THE THING THAT HAS IMPRESSED ME IS THE ROUND FOAM DISC. IT KEEPS THE SOCK'S HEEL IN PLACE SO THE SOCK GOES ON STRAIGHT. THE PRICE IS SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN THOSE WITHOUT THE FOAM DISC BUT IT IS WORTH THE EXTRA COST. THIS IS A " MUST " ITEM FOR ANYONE WHO HAS DIFFICULTY PUTTING ON SOCKS.
customer_reviews.author: IRISH

customer_reviews.title: A Godsend - though ridiculously WIDE!
customer_reviews.text: These are a godsend for anyone who is faced with surgery, those with range of motion limitations, or the elderly. I had surgery preventing me from bending over for several weeks, and this was a great solution. It's well made, affordable and does the job. I did reduce the rating by one star because the bed of the sock aid is ridiculously wide and stretches the socks out considerably. It would be nice if they either reduced the width, or came out with a second, narrower product.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: For such a simple device, it works amazingly well. My husband had hip replacement surgery and it took a while before he could dress himself. Eventually, he could put on all his clothes except for his socks, which I was still putting on for him. I bought this thing and it worked so well he was able to do it himself the first time. He is in love with it because it gave him back his last bit of independence. He said the creator should be awarded a Nobel prize for the design!
customer_reviews.author: Pearlh

customer_reviews.title: Really Fantastic!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey this thing works great. Took me less than five minutes to use this to put my socks on the first time I laugh at the size rope they put on these, a 1/4 " would be over kill. I'm seventy with size 11 & 1/2 " feet, basically just had a little tension on ropes, feet just slid right into the socks, had to laugh how easy it was. I know this sounds like a heavy pitch to sell these things but not, it's a fact, they could not have made a better product! So very much worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This made my life easier.
customer_reviews.text: I hate that I even need a product like this but I do because I'm getting older and fatter. That being said I can't believe how easy this is to use. I'm okay with my left foot but my body does not Bend too well to the right and this product has helped out immensely. I even use it for both feet now because it is so easy to use . I definitely recommend this sock Aid. Update I have used this sock Aid for 6 months now and I'm even more satisfied with this product than I was when I first bought it. It literally has made my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: tackless

customer_reviews.title: Once sock on the device-great helper
customer_reviews.text: This particular device was recommended by the rehab for my husband. We had used one that had more "give" but in the end, once the sock is on the device, much easier. It works easily with the hospital socks but the at home socks took a little more effort to get on the device. However, once on, the thick ropes and smooth surface went over his foot easily. For now, I'm putting the sock on the device-more because my husband lacks the patience to do it but once on-easy for him to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Really useful product
customer_reviews.text: Was given one of these years ago following hip replacement surgery by OT. It worked beautifully in helping me get socks on when I was not allowed to bend down. I lent it out to friends post surgery and lost track of it. I bought this aid in preparation for a new surgery with the hope it would help me get those infernal TED pressure stockings on post-op. Sadly it doesn't actually work well with those; they are just too constraining it seems. But the aid is as useful as ever for getting socks on. I would recommend it for anyone who can't seem to reach their feet anymore, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: It really works. I was skeptical because there are so many promises made by advertisers. I have a very hard time with things like putting on shoes and socks due to fibromyalgia. Because it hurts so much I have to rely on my husband most days to do that for me. It is not something I want to burden him with, it limits my independence and forces me to either stay in or put them on early in the morning before he goes to work and wear them all day. This and a long shoe horn mean I can do it myself and to me that means freedom.
customer_reviews.author: T Allen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It slips the sock on halfway up my foot cannot get it to go around the heel the pad on top does not grip at all Don’t waste your money. Got another one from the VA it has a garter belt clips that hold onto the top of the sock don’t know what they were thinking when they designed his thing
customer_reviews.author: Gbone

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the size as it doesn't work all that great on women's socks.
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought one of these it was for my husband and he loves it. So I ordered one for me. The reason I have it a lower rating here is that it is too wide for women's sock! I have to wear completely cotton socks and I have an extremely hard time getting the sock on it and then when I do and pull the sock on it is stretched out!! Following up on my complaint about this kindle pad it kept changing the word sock to sick!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly43

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second one. I have severe arthritis in my lower back. A coworker gave me one several years ago after he had a hip replacement. I fell in love with it. I completely wore the pull straps out and it started to crack down the middle. This was after at least 10-11 years of use. I found this one on Amazon. It was inexpensive and was actually sturdier than the old one. If you have trouble putting on socks get this thing. You will be amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Ghee

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my dad's OT requested.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a different type of sock aid at a local drugstore. It had hard sides and was not as easy to use as this type of aid. The rope and the foam handles allow my father, who has Parkinson's Disease and weighs 360 lbs, the ability to manage the aid in a way that allows him to get his socks onto his feet without another human assisting him. His Occupational Therapist suggested that I purchase this type verses the type that we had previously tried.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: It works sort of. It is a good idea but I wear a men's size 13 extra wide. I have had this device for many months. The socks fit onto the device just fine but I can barely get my wide foot to fit into this device. I have to really work at it. When I finally get my foot into it then it does let me slip my sock on. I had another similar device before this one that was wider. I think if your foot is normal width it would work well.
customer_reviews.author: Chanlesa

customer_reviews.title: It's the only one that works
customer_reviews.text: Most of these things have something wrong with the design. For instance the "blue" two-piece unit with the separate "T" handle, I can't get my slightly-wider-than-normal foot into, and it only works if one's foot is square with the chute. The RMS unit works perfectly every time. It will break eventually (I'm on my second one) with a crack from the edge of the chute to one of the rope holes, but it's cheap enough so that a replacement can be had quickly from Amazon. "Simple is the essence of good design" - Thomas Alva Edison
customer_reviews.author: George M. Graves

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I had very little problem using it the first time I tried it. I really like it. However, the instructions that came with it are almost useless. The photos are so washed out and dim it is difficult to figure out what they are trying to convey. I saw a video on the use of this device which made a world of difference. Now, if only there was a device that would remove the socks as easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Guzowsky

customer_reviews.title: Put your socks on by yourself agin
customer_reviews.text: I must have if you have restrictions for reaching your feet. I slide my socks right on. I had one after an injury, and was sure I wouldn't need it again, and threw it out when cleaning. I just had back surgery, not allowed to bend, so I bought another one. I don't really wear socks, but spa socks at bedtime. My only complaint, is that you stretch your sock opening by sliding it on the plastic piece. I am thinking my socks will stretch out at some point. (Design flaw). I No proof yet, though
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S

customer_reviews.title: The cords are knotted on the outside. When I ...
customer_reviews.text: The cords are knotted on the outside. When I use these sock aids I generally place it between my knees and fit the sock over the end. These knots on the outside kind of hurt when I do this. This is just a personal thing. I doubt if other users even have a problem. In any case, I prefer the flexible type. I thought I'd try the ridged plastic but it doesn't suit me.
customer_reviews.author: Red R.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: I do believe this is the “find of the year” for me. It has been impossible to put on my thigh high compression stockings. After carefully reading reviews and watching videos, I selected this product. I couldn’t be more happy than I am after purchasing this. Highly recommend for everyone who has trouble putting on compression stockings. Whoever invented this was a genius. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Colver

customer_reviews.title: Laughably easy and convenient to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and bought this because the doctor's office suggested some sort of device to help with putting on socks. My brother-in-law had surgery and was to convalesce in our home. Bending was a no-no post operation. Personally, I looked askance at the Sock Aid because it seemed almost like such a rinky-dink device. But my brother-in-law came out enthusiastically for it once he tried it post-surgery. He admitted that he had felt the same as I did but laughed when he experienced how easily and smoothly it worked. He said he still laughs when he uses it. Now I am wondering if there is a king-sized version for putting on pants.
customer_reviews.author: kenp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift for elderly parents
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for my parents (mid-70s). My mom was having to put my dad’s socks on EVERYDAY. My dad said he had a little trouble getting his socks on it at first, but “it works like a charm”. Having to depend on someone else to put on your socks & shoes each day can be humiliating to some people. I could hear the joy & happiness in his voice when he “just called to tell” me how much he loves his gift. My mom loves it too. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: C Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Great help! Can put my socks on myself again!
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use. I first used these following back surgery to help get my regular socks on. I now where compression socks and this is a huge help getting them on by myself. Couldn’t do it with out this. Compression socks start to crack this and all the others I’ve use after about a year or so but even with that it is well worth the money! Have recommended it to friends and family and they love them too!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Painful on arthritic feet
customer_reviews.text: It works surprisingly well, even getting the sock around the heel of the foot every time. The parts I don't like are that, to get the sock onto the aid, I have to hold the aid between my knees, which usually hurt, (and pull with my hands/fingers, which also hurt, but that's true in any case) and then the aid is narrow and cramps my swollen feet. It's not horrible, and the aid really works quite simply and easily, but I'll be buying the flexible style for use with ordinary socks.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd had this years ago!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sock Aid to help me put my socks on after hip-replacement surgery. It works great. I went to YouTube to see how it works - "Using A Sock Aid" is a nice, short, and complete instruction. It even works on the compression socks they have you wear. I've had hip issues for years and now I wish I'd known about this amazing tool. Putting on socks has always been a painful process.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: A study in frustration.
customer_reviews.text: It was easier to put the sock directly on my leg than to struggle with putting the sock on this product and then attempt to get it on my leg.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne  pizzimenti

customer_reviews.title: Not for Compression socks and large feet 13 eee
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for compression socks and large feet. It is more flexible and wider than the VIVE , I was able to get the sock onto the unit, but, Putting the Sock on to the unit ,the pressure of the sock made the unit very narrow ,I could not get my foot Into the unit. Waste of money for compression socks I bought the vive that is also a waste of money for compression socks with large feet.
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your foot size!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace an older model that had a rigid handle. I'm a size 11 shoe wearer, so socks in that size are hard to fit on the sock unit. First use, one of the ropes pulled out of the plastic, so I had to repair it. It works sometimes just fine, then other times seem to stick and wedges the foot in the sock holder. It probably works just fine for those with smaller feet!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stricklett

customer_reviews.title: I’m sure for an able-bodied person with two cans that these would be excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I am one handed, and these were entirely useless for me. I needed two hands in order to get the socks on the sock aid and therefore on my foot. Useless. I’m sure for an able-bodied person with two cans that these would be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wedgwood

customer_reviews.title: RMS Deluxe Sock Aid with Foam Handle are AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with my hip rotation and range of motion issues and I dreaded putting on socks because it was so painful to try to reach down far enough to put them on. This device is so wonderful! I slide the sock onto it, put my foot inside the ramp and smoothly slide the sock on. Love this. If you are having problems bending over and putting socks on, this is THE item to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Marvi Labrador

customer_reviews.title: Simple, great working product.
customer_reviews.text: This simple product works great. I had an older one than finally wore out and I ordered 2 this time so that I could have one always in my suitcase for traveling (and more easily not forget to pack it). A tip- you can add a little powder on it after loading your sock on it if you find there's resistance as you pull it on (as there might be just after showering for example).
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Regain your indepencence
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I was having Knee Replacement Surgery. I knew that I most likely would need help to get my socks on after the surgery. I wanted to do it myself and not have to ask someone else to put my socks on for me. I have been using this product daily for three weeks not and absolutely love how it frees me to put my socks on when I wat to put them on. Do I recommend it? Yes! Yes! Yes! I am very happy, to say the least
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Giglio

customer_reviews.title: Helps As Promised
customer_reviews.text: Due to arthritis pain I find it hard to put on my socks, and we researched options and ordered this, and it arrived promptly and works fine. Fairly simple device and meets my need. I might get a second, or a smaller one, to leave in my gym bag so when I change at the Y after swimming or working out I can use it again. This fills the need for which it is marketed, and is reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Who

customer_reviews.title: Correction: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: When you have a knee joint replaced, it's necessary to have some help at home for a couple of weeks. When this item arrived - ahead of schedule - a friend opened the box and found the big item, missed the smaller item - the SockAid. As a result I posted that "it hasn't arrived yet". In getting the packaging ready to recycle, I found the SockAid and have been using it. Works Great! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not for compression hose.
customer_reviews.text: Item purchased to assist with putting on compression socks, which are, by nature, tight. I struggled several times to use the sock aid as directed, and failed completely to get the sock on the device. It might work with normal socks for someone who can't bend at the waist, but for challenging elasticated socks, it's a bust.
customer_reviews.author: Old Actor

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great for awhile then the black pad comes off on back and it will not bring sock around heel and up foot. The pad is very important!!! I purchased a secound one the EVA Medical and it works better because the pad stays off, it is very similiar design but a bit larger and a dollar less expensive. I have requested RMS to send me a new pad. If they do then I will change my star rating. Now a test of customer service! Today is 8 16 2017. I purchased on January 2017, eight months ago. Pad fell off about 4-6 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kokito

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use to put your socks on if you have arthritis pain or lack of mobility. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: i have arthritis in my knees and was having problems getting my sox on due to stiffness and pain. I ordered this sock aid, which is identical to one that the insurance company provided to me years ago after some surgery ( lost the original one), and it is perfect. slip the sock onto the plastic piece in the device, hold the padded handles in your hands, with the plastic part lying on the floor open side up, slide the foot into the plastic piece that is holding the sock, and pull the cords. when you pull the cords, the sock is pulled up over the foot.
customer_reviews.author: gloria grb

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for herniated or buldged disc
customer_reviews.text: I am 32 years old and I have some lower back pain associated with a herniated/buldged disc. This product was a game changer for me in being able to put on socks unassisted. It allowed me to get dressed to get back to work on light duty. I just had to stuff the shoelaces into my shoe and slip them on without tying. I also purchased a extension grabber with a hook on top of the grabber pulling socks and pants up. The hook on top for taking socks off. 37 days after my incident I am slowly getting better, and I have these tools to thank for aiding me in that.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Master Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not good for compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because I have arthritic wrists. Okay for regular socks. Terrible for compression socks. Compression socks are difficult to place on the device. Very hard on my arthritic wrists. Then, my size 12 foot would not fit into device without causing foot and toe pain because the device collapses under the pressure of the compression sock. Had to powder my foot to get it to slide into the device and then to slide the sock onto my leg. It took a lot of work. It's easier putting on my compression socks using just powder.
customer_reviews.author: darryl gillit

customer_reviews.title: Sock helper
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my Mother as she has mobility issues due to aging and a mild stroke. It was recommended by her PT to help her get her compression stockings on. The devise does work, but for someone who already has mobility issues she finds it hard to get the sock on the devise and then be coordinated enough to to get a hold of the rope handles and follow through with the motions. If someone just had issues bending their leg or perhaps bending over i can see where this might be a good aid. For someone who had mobility issues I dont find this aid helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works exactly as you expect it to!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the sock aid for my husband who has psoriatic arthritis and has been finding it difficult to put his socks on. It works great. He's able to use it with athletic socks, dress socks, and heavy boot socks. I showed him the little video in the review section, and it worked perfectly on the first try. Thank you for a simple, sturdy, easy to use, and affordable product that makes a real difference in helping people with physical challenges be more independent.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: HELPFUL BUT NOT A TOTAL FIX
customer_reviews.text: When my ankles are extremely swollen I have trouble getting my support socks on. This device helps a lot and is very sturdy and well made. The only problem I have are my hands. It is sometimes difficult to get the sock on the plastice far enough when my arthritis is hurting. That is the only negative thing. Otherwise a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Sock Aid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this RMS Sock Aid for my 84 year old uncle that was introduced to this device at his recent stay at a Rehab Facility after 4 days in the hospital with a painful old knee injury. He liked the one at Rehab so much he had packed it up to "go home" with him! Ha, ha ... so of course I bought him his very own "sock assistant" to use every morning!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Winstead

customer_reviews.title: ... and osteoarthritis and putting my socks on was very painful and difficult
customer_reviews.text: I have both rhuematoid arthritis and osteoarthritis and putting my socks on was very painful and difficult. My husband would help when he was home but most days I had to struggle to put them on. I researched various devices and this gadget was highly recommended so I gave it a try. I could not be more pleased! Super easy to use and small enough to stash in my bathroom cupboard. I highly recommend this for anyone that struggles with getting socks on! I have my dignity back too!😁
customer_reviews.author: D. Vick

customer_reviews.title: It breaks in half after use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these. The first one lasted a year before it broke in half when compressing it to put a sock on it. The second one (a free replacement for the first one) lasted five months before it broke. I only use it to put on compression socks, which are tight and therefore need the item to be able to be squeezed together a fair amount.
customer_reviews.author: Wm W Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for after operation. The width of the plastic slide is a bit narrow, so for a man's wide width foot, it's a bit cramped. Would prefer to have the black grip part all across the top to help hold the sock in place. Don't like the type of cord used in the pull straps. If didn't need it right away, would've sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: MommaRosa8903

customer_reviews.title: Good when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Did not think I would ever need help putting socks on. Was I ever wrong! Back surgery taught me very quickly that I could not bend down any more. It took me a while to learn how to use it but after following the directions closely, it works very well. Update 1/11/2018 - I have been using the Sock Aid every day since September, 2017 and have not had any problems. It has turned out to be one of the best/helpful things I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Oldster

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my long skinny feet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before my hip surgery, and I'm so glad I did. It makes it easy to socks on. I don't agree with others who complain about breakage. Mine is made of a strong flexible plastic material that should last for a few years. It might not work if you've got Flintstone Feet, but I bet it's OK with a DD or E shoe. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Reid Davis

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT put your socks on without fiddling a LOT
customer_reviews.text: If you looked at a picture of this thing and thought how in the world could that possibly put a sock on, then you're absolutely right. It won't. At best, this can start a sock onto your foot, then you will spend more time pulling, twisting and adjusting that you would have spent just struggling with your socks in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Radio Man

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I just had two discs fused and was looking for some sort of gizmo to help get my socks on. After looking at several types, I landed on this one. Glad I did. It comes with a plastic cylinder you wrap a sock around, put your foot into, and two sturdy ropes to pull them up. The sock pulls right to the top, just as if you had done it by hand. No wrinkles or snags of any kind. Bottom line: It's a simple, durable product that works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Winger

customer_reviews.title: A good helping device
customer_reviews.text: When I first viewed this device I was a bit leary that it would work. I used it with a support hose that was new and a bit tight, the sock bent the device so that I was unable to put my foot in all the way but despite this I was able to put the sock on by myself. I haven't used them with regular socks yet but I have no doubt that it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Stretches my socks too much!
customer_reviews.text: The front contour needs to be tapered because it is more difficult to put the sock on to the device. I have used some with the slits in the plastic and it was a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja888

customer_reviews.title: Good product idea
customer_reviews.text: This product does indeed work as intended. I would give it a higher rating if I Had someone to get the socks onto it. My problem is that I am weak in my hands and getting the socks onto the sock aid is more difficult than just putting them on my feet. Squeezing the form between my knees is also a no go do to weakness. I think this product would be excellent if you have a caregiver to get the socks onto the aid, as the aid does do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Photog

customer_reviews.title: Larger/wide feet may be uncomfortable using this item.
customer_reviews.text: The device works as advertised. When used property, it will pull socks all of the way up your calves. I think this item should be sold in sizes. My shoe size is 10.5 EEE (US), and I have some difficulty in pushing my foot into the smaller, mostly-round, rigid portion of the item. I doubt many people have round feet, but I can see how a round portion helps in the later stages of pulling on the sock. My view is that it works OK for me, but would be better for someone with smaller feet.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY L FEICHTENBINER

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my mother
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sock Aid for my mother at the recommendation of an occupational therapist. One was left for my mother until the one I purchase arrived. It has helped her be more independent as she is not able to bend or have the range of motion with her arms to things like put her socks on. This device is lightweight and the ropes help her to easily do the task by herself, which is important as being independent as possible is empowering when older people start losing abilities.
customer_reviews.author: bookaholic

customer_reviews.title: Takes Practice
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandfather after a back surgery. I like how wide this is to fit a wide range of foot sizes. However, the way the rope is secured cuts off the opening, rubs against the skin, and makes using this uncomfortable and not as easy as expected. The ropes need to be strapped or velcrowed on. Move slowly!! The sock/helper doesn’t stay securely on once the foot is in and the sock is being pulled up. The heel can come undone. The sock will still pile around the heel area because the helper runs off mid placement. Handles are sized comfortably. Compact.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am in my nineties and no longer as supple as formerly. Reaching all the way down to my toes to draw socks over them has become an agony. I began to avoid socks altogether, wearing sandals instead, but sandals aren't always appropriate. I've now been using the RMS Deluxe Sock Aid for about a week and a half, and what a relief it has been! They work just as advertised. Putting on socks is no longer an agony but a pleasure, and I enjoy using he device. It is sturdily made and looks like it will last a long time. I wholeheartedly recommend it. !
customer_reviews.author: Jan A. van Laer

customer_reviews.title: Dignity
customer_reviews.text: I'm unable to put a sock on one of my feet and have relied on my spouse to do it. This simple device has enabled me to do this simple thing and it's actually an important act for me in terms of dignity and self reliance. Easy to use and reliable, I laugh inside whenever I use it, and laughter is the best medicine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver after hip replacement surgery
customer_reviews.text: Makes putting on the compression socks I have had to wear since my surgery so much easier than my wife and I thought it could be. The physical therapist at the hospital made me aware of the sock-aid before I was released from the hospital. It has truly been a lifesaver. The sock-aid was inexpensive and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Steve from Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: A Great Help!
customer_reviews.text: This sock aid is helpful for anyone who has a hard time getting socks on. It is so simple and efficient. I was glad to be introduced to this gadget after I suffered a shattered femur. I then ordered one to give to a friend who was having some mobility problems. The beauty of it is its simplicity. There is a more expensive version advertised on TV, but this is all you need!
customer_reviews.author: Victorian Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for compression socks!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for compression socks! I had a more flexible sock aid that's great for tights and lighter hosiery, but compression socks just tore that up. This is great for them though! They hook onto the top of the cuff, there's an anti-slip pad on the bottom, it's a great solution! The handles are easy to grab or you can tie them into loops if you have arthritis or other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm waiting for hip replacement surgery and unable to reach my feet to put socks on. This has really given me some independence back, I don't have to depend on someone else to put my socks on for me. I'm a petite person and in my 20's, so my socks are small (sometimes kids size) and I find that this does stretch some of my socks out nearly to the point of ripping. I've just learned which pairs I can use with this assist. It's difficult to put on longer socks, it can't really pull the socks up your leg past your ankle. But overall, it's been a huge help to me.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I got this sock puller to aid myself after a major back surgery. I am 31 and wear short athletic socks which easily fit over the half pipe of the puller. This allowed the device pull the sock all the way up my ankle and fit onto toe so I didn't have to adjust or put my foot on the carpet to adjust the sock which I could not have done because of the surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Discko

customer_reviews.title: challenging
customer_reviews.text: this is a great accessory for those who cannot bend over to put on socks or stockings....however, my socks/stockings were too narrow for the tube and slipped off before i got it on my foot...someone has told me that there is one that ins more narrow that would be better for this purpose, but i have not checked into it...
customer_reviews.author: GAFAN

customer_reviews.title: Will your socks fit over this sock aide?
customer_reviews.text: The “big” size of the white semi tube. I have tried several different styles of socks. They do not fit very well on the part (essential part). I have seen two ways of putting the sock over this tube and neither way works very well. Have not found another product to assist with dressing my feet, I will keep looking. Delivery time was great the product was as described.
customer_reviews.author: PAL

customer_reviews.title: the video was fantastic using this product
customer_reviews.text: We haven't tried this yet but our seminar at the hospital for knee surgery said this was the product to get to put on socks where you couldn't bend your knee for awhile.....the video was fantastic using this product,,,,the nurse said she wishes she invented it. So it must be a winner for people with hip and knee surgery. I would recommend this for anyone that can't bend their hips, knees, to get down to put socks on.....
customer_reviews.author: Marsha1113

customer_reviews.title: Just Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product ten stars I would. I was very hesitant to order it because I didn't believe it would work. But it does! It works Extremely well! And with very little effort needed. Because of disc issues, plus arthritis in my back and hips as well as my right knee, and intermittent sciatica, I went without socks or nylons on most occasions. But not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... few other types but so far this are the best. the other one were good did there job ...
customer_reviews.text: i have tried a few other types but so far this are the best.the other one were good did there job very good but this one is great it does have room for large size foot were the other i had a little bit of a hard time with them. this one is even stiffer an does not bend together as much so it makes it easy for big foot again. the rope handgrips is a nice touch for use with big hands are have other problems with there grip and a big improvement over the straps that other ones have used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Don

customer_reviews.title: Very easy!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried it once at home and it worked perfectly. Haven't used it again because I got it for my trips and I haven't traveled so not sure how long it will last. Seems very sturdy, well made and it's a great invention. I definitely recommend it. It was very easy to use! Now my problem is how to take them off...
customer_reviews.author: Anabel M.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: My neurosurgeon down in South Carolina gave me one of these before I left MUSC it is a godsend after the surgery that I had on my back and then had knee Replacements to two and a half months later I wore the one out the doctor got me and I finally found out where to get a new one I use it often I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless. I have a fairly narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: Almost useless. I have a fairly narrow foot, (size 11 men's) and it barely fits inside the device without putting a sock over it. Putting a sock over the device compresses it even more, so that it is a real struggle to pull it back. If I thought that it was worth the trouble,I'd send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: After 2 hip replacements, one that did not go well, I found this product to be very helpful in allowing me to painlessly put on my socks again. It has worked 100% of the time and the only minus I have found is that it is a little narrow with a plastic that does not allow a smooth slid onto the sock. But that having been said, I do recommend and the price is far less than some of the ones with all the hoopla.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Ron

customer_reviews.title: A simple product that is a big help.
customer_reviews.text: This tool works. I have pain in one knee that made it difficult to put on a sock. I'll be truthful, I chose this one among the products listed because it has a local connection. Guess what, it is simple to use and my knee has been getting better without the daily contortion necessary to put on my sock. The only thing I can suggest to them...make the instructions a bit clearer. The process is simple and easy--after you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: billsa

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe it till I tried this and it works great. I have a bad hip so getting socks on is a painful challenge. Not any more! This contraption works as advertised! Even with my small golfing compression socks. I wear a 13 shoe so my socks are larger than many folks but this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jordy

customer_reviews.title: Works Well With Stretchy Socks, But Too Stiff for Some
customer_reviews.text: This device is a great post-surgical aid for back surgery when bending is restricted. But for shoulder surgeries, it may tax your strength. It is made of good quality, smooth plastic that eases the process of getting one’s socks on, but it can be hard to bend enough to slide thick or tight-weave socks onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C.

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: While awaiting knee surgery, I was having a lot of problems bending down to put on socks. This was recommended during a pre-surgery class, and it works great! Sturdy, super easy to use, and works perfectly with every type of sock I've tried it with, even heavy wool ones. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: bendwriter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome simple product
customer_reviews.text: Had back surgery 2 weeks ago. Haven’t been able to reach left foot for months. Got this item 2 days ago and am wishing I had bought months ago. Easy to use and works flawlessly. No more having to ask for help putting left sock on. If you are struggling with back problems and can’t reach your toes with 2 hands to put your sock on, just buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Once I learned the best way to mount the sock onto the helper -- which took about four minutes of trial and error practice -- it blew me away. Fast, easy, and extremely effective. Pulling on socks was painful on my back and elbows. Now no pain. I won't travel without this thing. I wish I had bought it years ago. As we used to say in the Army "this thing's slicker than greased owl snot!"
customer_reviews.author: grtroes

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to finally find a product that works as advertised. Just put the sock on the end of the cuff, insert foot all the way in, pull on the two ropes, and the sock slips all the way up to the ankle. My mother is 92 years old and had no problem. Highly recommend this product. Can't go wrong for the price, plus it actually WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If your legs and feet are extra wide it won't work. My aunt is diabetic and her feet are very wide. She wear a 10 1/2 xw and it doesn't work for her. It works for me. I wear a 9 1/2 medium to wide depending on the shoes. My husband is a 11 1/2 medium and it works for him, as well. The product work great and it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Cracks every couple months
customer_reviews.text: As a disabled person I’ve bought these many times, and they are very helpful and necessary. The problem is that the plastic is too brittle and *always* cracks down the middle after a month or two of use. I use everyday regular cotton tube socks, nothing unusual. I actually was cut on my ankle by this product cracking mid use. And so, I keep ordering them over and over. The plastic that needs to be used to manufacture these needs to be more flexible and less brittle.
customer_reviews.author: scott hricsina

product_meta.title: RMS Deluxe Sock Aid - Socks Helper with Foam Handles
feature_bullets: Deluxe Socks Put On Assist Device: Helps individuals put on socks or stockings easily and independently. Ideal daily living aid for those having difficulty to bend down, recovering from back, knee or hip replacement surgery or for those with limited mobility.
Flexible Contoured Plastic Shell: Contour shaped shell is Soft and flexible, specially designed for individuals who have weak hand strength, making it easy to insert socks onto the sock aid.
Soft and Non-Slip Foam Handle for a comfortable grip. A Slip-Resistant Foam Pad keeps sock or stocking from slipping off of the sock assist.
Adjustable Ropes: Overall 38" long with shell and cords. The ropes can be adjusted to your desired length by tying new knots as needed.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
